bwwExcerpt: This exuberant, phenomenally well-executed 'concert' avoids the lurid vortex-of-darkness that similar biographical shows (most recently, 'Lady Day') revel in. The heroin-addicted, Southern Comfort-swilling, sexually ambiguous Joplin arrives on Broadway essentially stripped of her rough edges.
